page.title: 08Industry, south of Buriton
page.content: The area has a small modern engineering firm, Circuit Engineering Marketing Co Ltd, has evolved from an engineering company formed in the early 1960s and moved to the Buriton site of the disused limeworks in 1973. A wide range of machinery for the printed circuit board industry is both manufactured and marketed. Approx. 50% of sales are exported through 20 agents based in various countries. An associate company in Petersfield operates services for hot air levelling and bare board testing. Buriton saw mills is also situated in a disused chalk pit. A recent change of ownership has led to modernisation. The mill used improved larch timber and produces gates and fencing panels. Other employment includes; decorating china, breeding Afghan hounds and servicing garden machinery.
